dependencies.description: Hatch plugin for versioning with your preferred VCS
dependencies.name: py-hatch-vcs

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm

dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description: Handy tools for working with URLs and APIs.
dependent_to.name: py-apeye

dependent_to.description:
Black is the uncompromising Python code formatter. By using it, you
agree to cede control over minutiae of hand-formatting. In return, Black
gives you speed, determinism, and freedom from pycodestyle nagging about
formatting.
dependent_to.name: py-black

dependent_to.description:
data distribution geared toward scientific datasets. DataLad makes data
management and data distribution more accessible. To do that, it stands
on the shoulders of Git and Git-annex to deliver a decentralized system
for data exchange. This includes automated ingestion of data from online
portals and exposing it in readily usable form as Git(-annex)
repositories, so-called datasets. The actual data storage and permission
management, however, remains with the original data providers.
dependent_to.name: py-datalad

dependent_to.description: Python dependency management and packaging made easy.
dependent_to.name: py-poetry

dependent_to.description:
Pooch manages your Python library's sample data files: it automatically
downloads and stores them in a local directory, with support for
versioning and corruption checks.
dependent_to.name: py-pooch

dependent_to.description:
PyCUDA gives you easy, Pythonic access to Nvidia's CUDA parallel
computation API
dependent_to.name: py-pycuda

dependent_to.description:
PyFR is an open-source Python based framework for solving advection-
diffusion type problems on streaming architectures using the Flux
Reconstruction approach of Huynh.
dependent_to.name: py-pyfr

dependent_to.description: A collection of tools for Python
dependent_to.name: py-pytools

dependent_to.description: virtualenv is a tool to create isolated Python environments.
dependent_to.name: py-virtualenv

description:
A small Python module for determining appropriate platform-specific
dirs, e.g. a "user data dir"
name: py-platformdirs

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: Install from wheel (required for bootstrapping Spack)
variants.name: wheel
